title: Ericameria suffruticosa
text:
Ericameria suffruticosa (<a href="common%20name">common name</a> - singlehead goldenbush) is a <a href="subshrub">subshrub</a> to shrub in the sunflower family (<a href="Asteraceae">Asteraceae</a>) found in the western <a href="United%20States">United States</a> (<a href="California">California</a>, <a href="Nevada">Nevada</a>, <a href="Oregon">Oregon</a>, <a href="Idaho">Idaho</a>, <a href="Nevada">Nevada</a>, <a href="Wyoming">Wyoming</a>, <a href="Montana">Montana</a>). "Suffruticosa" means "shrublike".
Description.
"Ericameria suffruticosa" is a subshrub to shrub tall. It has sticky, small, gray-green leaves that are wavy at the edges and highly <a href="aromatic">aromatic</a> when crushed. One plant can produce several yellow <a href="flower%20heads">flower heads</a> with irregular structure, having its few <a href="disk%20flowers">disk flowers</a> pointing in all directions, and 1-6 <a href="ray%20flowers">ray flowers</a> haphazardly placed around the disk. The species grows from in elevation on rocky flats, ledges, and exposed ridges in <a href="mountain">mountain</a> and <a href="alpine%20plant">alpine</a> <a href="plant%20communities">plant communities</a>.
